intro: Brassica leucantha, commonly known as the white cabbage. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its cruciform flowers and edible leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with a rosette of broad, waxy leaves. Its flowers are small, white, and arranged in a raceme, attracting pollinators such as bees. The plant is cultivated for its leaves, which are used in various cuisines around the world.
